original: Lundin, Claes Tore, provinsialläkare, Stegeborg, f. 6/12/06 i Norrköp. av läroviadj. Claes Gustav L. o. Sigrid Maria Flammén. G. 37 m. Astrid Eliisabet Söderström. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 25, med. kand. 29 o. med. lic. 35 i Upps. E. o. aman. v. patolog, inst. i Upps. 32-33, förordn. s. und:-läk. v. san. i Sundsvall 35, s. asisis’t:-läk. o. aman. v. Akad. sjukh. kir. klin. 36 ö. 37, s. stadsläk. i Avesta 36, s. und :läk. v. Finspångs las. 36 o. 37, e. läk. v. NoTrköp. las. barmb:- o. gynekolog, avd. 37, und :läk. o. tf. las :-läk. v. las. i Finspång 40-45, und :läk. o. tf. överläk. v. kvinnoklin. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. i Gbg 45-47, provrläk. i Stege-borgs distr. sed. 47.
translated:
Lundin, Claes Tore, provincial doctor, Stegeborg, b. 6/12/06 in Norrköping, son of teacher's assistant Claes Gustav L. and Sigrid Maria Flammén. Married in 1937 to Astrid Elizabeth Söderström. 

Education: Completed high school in Norrköping in 1925, obtained a Bachelor of Medicine degree in 1929, and a medical license in 1935 from Uppsala University. Employed as an intern and assistant at the Pathology Institute in Uppsala from 1932 to 1933. Appointed as an assistant physician at a tuberculosis sanatorium in Sundsvall in 1935, as well as an assistant physician and intern at the surgical clinic of the University Hospital in Uppsala in 1936 and 1937. Became the town physician in Avesta in 1936, and an assistant physician at Finspång Hospital in 1936 and 1937. Started working as a gynecologist and obstetrician at Norrköping Hospital in 1937, as well as an assistant physician and temporary chief physician at the hospital in Finspång from 1940 to 1945. Also worked as an assistant physician and temporary senior physician at the Women's Clinic at Sahlgren Hospital in Gothenburg from 1945 to 1947. Finally, appointed as a provincial doctor in the Stegeborg district in 1947.
